name: places/ChIJqwmmhbpYwokReOuxaYRVM1c
adrFormatAddress: 1676 1st Ave., New York, NY 10128-4854, USA

originalText.text: Dr. G is really great, but it is so difficult to get in touch with anyone at this office. Our cat was prescribed medicine during the summer, and we were asked to follow up with them after he finished the medicine. I called several times but never got a response, so I left a message and never heard back. I called in November to make an appointment for our cat to get his booster shots in December and clean his teeth. The receptionist said he needed to consult the doctor to get an estimate and would call me back in 24-48 hours. I waited a week and then called them again to see if they had the estimate ready, but no one answered. My husband and I called them every day for a week straight so that we could book the appointment. We left messages again for them to call us back. No one ever answered the phone or returned our messages. It's unfortunate as Dr. G is so great with our cat, but working with this place is such a hassle. We've found another vet in the area that is more responsive and has a website where you can make appointments.

originalText.text: I have been working Dr. G for over 20 years. He is professional and courteous.  I trust him with all my dogs and recommended him to my clients and friends.

text.text: I have been working Dr. G for over 20 years. He is professional and courteous.  I trust him with all my dogs and recommended him to my clients and friends.

originalText.text: It doesn't get better than Dr. G.  He has always provided the best care for my pets and I've had quite a few! Yes sometimes the wait could be a bit long, but it's because he doesn't rush through an appointment and he is extremely thorough during an examination. Thanks for all the care and support you have provided to Rebecca, Layla, Madison, Duke, and Cookie.

text.text: It doesn't get better than Dr. G.  He has always provided the best care for my pets and I've had quite a few! Yes sometimes the wait could be a bit long, but it's because he doesn't rush through an appointment and he is extremely thorough during an examination. Thanks for all the care and support you have provided to Rebecca, Layla, Madison, Duke, and Cookie.

originalText.text: I don‚Äôt understand how this place operates without a computer. If you look past the front desk, you will see walls of cabinets filled with file folders that hold client records. It echoes my dentist‚Äôs office in 1992. They charge you a 3.3% fee for using a credit card, or you can pay with cash or check (who the heck still uses physical checks?). The space reeks of neglect. I didn‚Äôt even realize someone was sitting behind the front desk when we walked in because he didn‚Äôt bother greeting us since it‚Äôs clear he hates his job. My dog did NOT want to be in that office at all. She was getting the same bad vibes as me. She kept trying to leave and I should have followed her out the door instead of going through with the appointment and exam, which was a waste of time and money. The vet very clearly was shooting in the dark to diagnose my dog, who was having excess vaginal discharge. He was trying to convince me that my dog is incontinent (she was discharging clear vaginal fluid, not urine) and that she has a heart murmur (all of the vets we‚Äôve seen prior and the vet we have seen subsequently have said my dog does NOT have a heart murmur). I don‚Äôt know how this guy has such a loyal client base with rave reviews on here when his service and methods seem to be operating within a 1990s time capsule. Go here if you don‚Äôt think modern instruments, technology, and record management systems are needed to help care for your dog. I have since gone to a vet that more closely matches my expectations and my usual experience with a professional vet.
